name: Zion National Park
description: Follow the paths where people have walked for thousands of years. Gaze up at massive sandstone cliffs of cream, pink, and red that soar into a brilliant blue sky. Experience the tall, stretching walls of a narrow slot canyon. Zion’s unique array of plants and animals will enchant you as you absorb the rich history of the past and enjoy the excitement of present-day adventures.
shortDescription: Follow the paths where people have walked for thousands of years. Gaze up at massive sandstone cliffs of cream, pink, and red that soar into a brilliant blue sky. Experience the tall, stretching walls...

operatingHours.description: Zion National Park is open every day of the year.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: Admits private, non-commercial vehicle (15 passenger capacity or less) and all occupants to Zion National Park. Valid for 1-7 days.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Entrance - Snowmobile
fees.description: Admits one individual with no car to Zion National Park. Typically used for bicyclists, hikers and pedestrians. Youth 15 and under are admitted free. Valid for 1-7 days.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: Admits one individual with no car to Zion National Park. Typically used for bicyclists, hikers and pedestrians. Youth 15 and under are admitted free. Valid for 1-7 days.

fees.title: Entrance - Non-commercial Groups
fees.description: $20 per person. Non-commercial vehicles with a capacity of 16 or greater. Fees will not exceed the commercial fee for the same-sized vehicle. Youth 15 and under are free. Individuals or families with any valid Annual or Lifetime pass may use their pass for entry at the per person rate. Pass and photo ID must be present upon entry.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Van
fees.description: A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. The entry fees of commercial tours are based upon the total capacity of vehicles that can carry seven or more passengers regardless of the actual number of passengers.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Mini-bus
fees.description: A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. The entry fees of commercial tours are based upon the total capacity of vehicles that can carry seven or more passengers regardless of the actual number of passengers.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Motor Coach
fees.description: A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. The entry fees of commercial tours are based upon the total capacity of vehicles that can carry seven or more passengers regardless of the actual number of passengers.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Per Person
fees.description:
A commercial tour is defined as one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. Vehicles with commercial tours of 1-6 people (not including guide) pay $35 per vehicle + $20 per person with a total fee not to exceed $70.

Passengers can use valid weekly, annual, lifetime, or appreciation passes.

fees.title: Nonresident
fees.description: Each non-US resident aged 16 and older visiting Zion National Park must pay a $100 nonresident fee (in addition to the standard entrance fee), unless admitted with an Annual or America the Beautiful Pass. This includes nonresidents entering as part of a commercial tour group, commercial use authorization (CUA) group, or concessioner tour group.

climate.weatherDescription: Zion is known for a wide range of weather conditions. Temperatures vary with changes in elevation and day/night temperatures may differ by over 30°F. In summer, temperatures in Zion National Park often exceed 100°F/38°C. Zion experiences monsoons from mid-July into September that result in an increased risk of flash floods. Always be aware of the threat of storms and lightning and be prepared for a wide range of weather conditions. Winters are generally mild.

images.title: The Watchman
images.altText: A triangular sandstone mountain overlooks green and yellow foliage. A cloudy blue sky is overhead.
images.caption: The Watchman in Zion Canyon

images.title: The Towers of the Virgin
images.altText: The sun sets behind large red and white towers of sandstone.
images.caption: The Towers of the Virgin in Zion Canyon

images.title: Zion Canyon Visitor Center
images.altText: A sandstone and glass building surrounded by tall trees with a mountain behind it.
images.caption: The Zion Canyon Visitor Center is a great place to stop to learn about the park!

images.title: The Narrows
images.altText: Tall, red, sandstone walls enclose a narrow river.
images.caption: The Narrows can be accessed at the end of Riverside Walk, just follow the river.

images.title: Kolob Arch
images.altText: A red sandstone arch under a clear blue sky.
images.caption: Deep in Zion's Wilderness site Kolob Arch, one of the largest free-standing arches in the world.
